question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Integer Overflow] At line 229, next_version_to_process += 1000 can overflow if it reaches u64::MAX, causing the backfiller to restart from 0 and reprocess all data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [File Write Race] At lines 245-246, progress file is written without atomic rename or fsync, can system crash during write corrupt the file, causing backfiller to lose all progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Premature Exit] At lines 251-255, the task calls exit(0) when ending_version is reached, but can race conditions cause it to exit before all uploads complete, losing in-flight data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Loop Continuation] At line 236, 'continue' is used if no update is needed, but can this tight loop without yielding cause CPU starvation for worker tasks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Deadlock Risk] At line 224, the lock on finished_starting_versions is held during the entire update loop (226-233), can this cause deadlock if workers are waiting to insert? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Panic on None] At line 267, item.unwrap() assumes stream always returns Some, but can stream end unexpectedly causing panic instead of graceful shutdown? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Error Handling] At lines 270-273, gRPC errors cause panic, but can transient network issues be exploited to repeatedly crash the backfiller preventing progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Unwrap on Response] At line 276, response.response.unwrap() will panic if response is None, can malicious fullnode send responses without the response field? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Buffer Growth] At lines 278-284, transactions_buffer is a BTreeMap that grows unbounded until BatchEnd signal, can a Byzantine fullnode never send BatchEnd causing memory exhaustion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Version Collision] At line 283, transactions are inserted by version key, if fullnode sends duplicate versions, will later ones silently overwrite earlier ones hiding data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Batch End Validation] At lines 287-289, BatchEnd signal triggers batch processing, but can a malicious fullnode send BatchEnd prematurely when buffer has < 1000 transactions, causing incomplete batches to be sent? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Loop Boundary] At line 290, 'while transactions_buffer.len() >= 1000' processes in 1000-tx chunks, but if buffer has 1999 transactions, will the remaining 999 be stuck in buffer forever? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Pop Order] At line 295, pop_first() is called assuming BTreeMap maintains version order, but if versions are not sequential, can this create gaps in the processed data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Channel Send Blocking] At line 298, sender.send().await can block if channel is full, can this cause the stream processing to halt indefinitely if workers are stuck? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Infinite Loop] The stream loop at line 265 has no exit condition except panic, can the fullnode keep streaming indefinitely preventing graceful shutdown? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate()] [Progress File Error Handling] At lines 306-314, if progress file read fails, it defaults to version 0, can this cause re-validation of already validated data wasting resources? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate()] [Unwrap on Ending Version] At line 318, ending_version.unwrap() will panic if ending_version is None in validation mode, can misconfiguration crash the validator? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate()] [Early Exit Without Cleanup] At lines 319-322, if validation is already done, exit(0) is called immediately, can this leave resources or locks unreleased? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Version Allocation Race] At lines 334-342, version_allocator is incremented by 1000, but can multiple threads read the same value before increment, causing duplicate validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Unwrap on Get Transactions] At line 343, get_transactions().unwrap() will panic on any retrieval failure, can storage errors or missing files crash all validation tasks? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Version Validation] At line 345, version equality is checked, but can integer overflow in version + idx cause wraparound accepting invalid data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Gap Detector Timing] At lines 348-349, versions are inserted into gap_detector after validation, but can the progress task read before insertion causing premature progress update? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Lock Contention] At line 348, gap_detector lock is acquired for each batch, can high contention when many workers finish simultaneously cause performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Early Return] At lines 337-339, workers return Ok(()) when version >= expected_end_version, but can some workers exit early while others are still processing, causing inconsistent state? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() progress task] [Nested Loop Logic] At lines 359-369, nested loops check gap_detector, can the inner loop miss versions if workers insert between outer loop iterations? (Medium)
